title: Slip and fall on wet concrete
description: Worker slipped on freshly washed concrete surface near Building A foundation. Minor abrasion on left knee. Worker returned to duty same day after first aid treatment.

title: Struck by falling lumber
description: 2x6 board fell from second floor scaffolding and struck worker on hard hat. No injury sustained. Hard hat cracked and replaced. Secured lumber staging area immediately.

title: Electrical shock - live wire contact
description: Electrician contacted live 120V circuit that was not properly locked out during panel work on floor 5. Received minor shock to right hand. Sent to clinic for evaluation. No burns or lasting effects.
location: Downtown Office Tower - Floor 5 Electrical Room

title: Caught between - scissor lift and column
description: Operator's hand was briefly caught between scissor lift railing and concrete column while positioning lift in tight corridor. Minor bruising. No fracture.

title: Heat illness - dehydration
description: Concrete finisher showed signs of heat exhaustion during summer foundation pour. Moved to shade and administered fluids. Transported to urgent care as precaution. Returned to work next day.
location: Riverside Apartments - Building B Slab Pour
